intro: Norantea brenesii, commonly known as the Brenes' orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, intricate flowers with vibrant colors. The plant typically grows on tree trunks or branches, exhibiting an epiphytic growth habit. Its leaves are elongated and革质, adapted to retain moisture in its humid, shaded habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Norantea brenesii is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
